page.title: 08Greenhaugh First School
page.content: The school was opened in 1966 to replace 2 schools at Hott and Thorneyburn. There are 13 children, rising to 18 in September and they range in age from 4-9 years. They travel up to 7 miles by school car from Falstone, Donkleywood, High Green and Carriteth Cottage. The majority live in isolated homes. The staff comprises; the headteacher, assistant teacher, cook/supervisor, cleaner in charge and clerk. Children work happily alongside each other in a stimulating family atmosphere. For most 3 R work they are taught in 2 groups ranging in age from 4-6 and 7-9 years. Because the groups are small the teachers are able to cater for individual needs. The school has almost an acre of ground including a pond, playground, natural area and trees many planted by the children.
